What Capitalism Was - Etoile Polaire - Plays the Music of Phillip Glass on Accordion What Capitalism Was - Subterraneans - Plays the Music of Phillip Glass on Accordion Chumbawamba - Dumbing Down (looping) - WYSIWYG What Capitalism Was - Resource - Plays the Music of Phillip Glass on Accordion What Capitalism Was - Knee 1 - Plays the Music of Phillip Glass on Accordion - Test Department - Comrade Enver Hoxva - Tactics for Evolution King Crimson - Epitaph - In the Court of the Crimson Kng The Kleptones - Mad Groove - Uptime Shooby Taylor, the Human Horn - Somewhere Over the Rainbow - Shooby Sings, 4801=PLAYLIST: Movin' On December 10, 2009, 2010, Friday, 12 noon to 1:30 pm KBOO Portland, OR: 90.7 Corvallis/Albany, OR: 100.7 Hood River/Columbia Gorge: 91.9 Host: Don Jacobson Posted to: Folkdj-l, www.kboo.fm Webcast on  http://www.kboo.fm (VA) = Various Artists.  All media are CDs unless otherwise stated. Artist: "Selection" ALBUM TITLE [Label] (VA) Will Geer: Excerpt from This Land Is Your Land "I Hate A Song That ..." A TRIBUTE TO WOODY GUTHRIE [Warner Bros.] ((Intro)) Sandy Rothman/Steve Pottier: "In the Pines" BLUEGRASS GUITAR DUETS [Sierra] ((Music Bed)) ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ (VA) Jay Mankita: "They Lied" PROTEST SONGS FOR A BETTER WORLD [Brian Gladstone] (VA) Larry Solomom: "Global Warming Blues" SONGS FOR A BETTER PLANET  [Brian Gladstone] (VA)Maria Dunn: "Trouble Maker" PROTEST SONGS FOR A BETTER PLANET  [Brian Gladstone] (VA) Dale Marsh: "Johnny Appleseed’s Lament" PROTEST SONGS FOR A BETTER PLANET VOL.2  [Brian Gladstone] ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Magical Strings: "Gypsy Melody" BELL OFF THE LEDGE [Flying Fish] Magical Strings: "The Green Island" THE LEGEND OF INISHCAHEY [Self] ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Magical Strings live at KBOO! ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Magical Strings: "Dinney O’Brien" CELTIC YULETIDE [Self] Bisceglia Family: "Burning of the Piper’s Hut" JOURNEY THROUGH THE HIGHLANDS [Self] ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Folk Calendar ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The Once: "Maid On the Shore" THE ONCE [Borealis] Carolina Chocolate Drops: "Peace Behind the Bridge" GENUINE NEGRO JIG [Nonesuch] Carolina Chocolate Drops: "Starry Crown" DONA GOT A RAMBLIN' MIND [Music Maker] Notorius: "Door Country" THE ROAD TO DAMASCUS [Black Socks Press] Maria Fairchild: "The Cuckcoo" CELEBRATION [Ampersand] ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ ((Outro)) Questions & comments are welcome., 10794=Here we are, with another episode of Radio Lost and Found - and the last one of 2010. At about the halfway mark, I mixed a mediascape of Senator Bernie Sanders heroic, though sadly ignored voice of reason filibuster speech to the Senate - trying to dissuade his colleagues to stop counting their cash long enough to vote no on the Bush/Obama tax cuts for billionaires. It's like hearing an obituary for the American dream - at least the one we're all supposed to live in - as opposed to the one that the wealthiest 2% get to live in. Sad, but worth listening to (Sanders' speech, not necessarily my mediascape).}
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {25561=Keep your ears tuned to the dial 90.7 FM Portland or on-line at K-B-O-O dot F-M for a chance to win a pair of tickets. The Monsters of Accordion play at the Kennedy School here in Portland, on Thursday, December 16th and YOU and a friend can win tickets!, 24099=With squeezeboxes strapped to their chests, the Monsters of Accordion are launching an assault on West Coast cities from Seattle to Los Angeles this December. The legendary Corn Mo, known for his work with Ben Folds, They Might Be Giants and The Bindlestiff Family Circus, fills the room with his epic voice and inimitable original songs. Pink-haired accordion pin-up goddess Renée de la Prade squeezes punk rock power into Celtic and zydeco melodies as she pounds the floorboards and pumps her low-slung button box. Just back from Serbia, The Petrojvic Blasting Company have burnt venues to the ground across Europe and North America with their fiery young take on Balkan gypsy music. They are joined by infamous accordion howler, Jason Webley, who organizes the annual tour and is known around the world for his gigantic voice, his frenzied squeezebox playing and the ability to make any room of strangers throw their arms around each other and sing their hearts out., 109427=Latest newsletter: May 2015, 117850=Copyright © 2012 KBOO Community Radio | Copyright Policy | Community Guidelines | Website Illustration & Design by: KMF ILLUSTRATION}
